summary: Harriet Tubman lived most of her life working to free her people. She was a leader of the Underground Railroad, a secret network of households that provided food and shelter to runaway slaves. Harriet led groups of slaves from one point to another on the perilous journey north, hiding during the day and traveling at night. She was a master of tricks and disguises, and a significant reward was offered for her capture. Her daring rescues helped hundreds of slaves escape to freedom.
